## Run the application & log in

When cdwtools package is installed, run the Shiny application with :

```r
cdwtools(language = "EN")
```

Available languages are "EN" & "FR".

The first time you launch the application, a **local database** is created, on the library directory.

Two users are created :

- an **admin** user, with login = admin & password = admin
- a **test** user, with login = test & password = test

First, **connect with the test user**.

## Patient-level data

Click on the **patient-level data** link on the header of the page.

With the **dropdowns on left side** of the page, select the **datamart** "Invasive mechanical ventilation", the **study**, "Predicting extubation success" & the **subset** "All patients".

Select **a patient**. You should have this screen :  



![](https://github.com/BorisDelange/cdwtools/blob/master/inst/app/www/get_started/patient_lvl_first_connection.jpg?raw=true)

Try to change the selected patient : the charts are reloaded with new data.

## Modules & plugins

The application works with two concepts : the **modules** & the **plugins**.

Once you have access to a datamart (a corpus of patients data), you can create modules using plugins.

A **module** is a page where you choose **which data to render** (by selected thesaurus items), and **how to render these data**, by selecting a plugin.

A **plugin** is a way to render data, eg a plugin named Dygraph renders data with a timeline, a plugin named Text renders data with text areas.

In the **patient-level data** page, you create modules to **visualize data** for each patient of the datamart.

In the **aggregated data** page, you create modules to **analyze data**.

Examples : 

- create a "**Patient management**" module, where you can create exclusion criteria & render the flowchart of your study
- create a "**Data cleaning**" module, where you clean your data, setting limit values of outlier data
- create a "**Report" module**", where you can create a report, using figures created in previous modules, dynamically updated

Try now to create your own module : click on **Parameters** link, on top of the page and go to **Patient-lvl modules** section.
